intro: Scrophularia nodosa, commonly known as the nodding scrophularia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Scrophularia nodosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows.
